page.title: 02Local History
page.content: Saxon/Angles names abound eg Pilling. Preesagh means a heath covered hill, and is of Scandinavian origin. Parrox Hall (03600478) is built on part of the Manor granted by King John to Geoffrey the Arbelestrier.It has been in the Elletson family (despite the Civil War) continuously since then! Preesall was part of Stalmine Parish and the Church of St Oswald's was built as a Chapel of Ease (03590485) IN 1898-9.As you will see the discovery of salt provided an impetus to the growth of population in Preesall but in Piling the rural nature remains.The area was inaccessible until the opening of the Garstang to Knott-End Railway, so that both villages were very self-contained and self-sufficient.Anyone who is not born and bred here will always be called "an incomer".
